Package com.berbils.game.Entities.FireEngines

Class FireEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.berbils.game.Entities.EntityTypes.Entity
      • com.berbils.game.Entities.EntityTypes.BoxGameEntity
        • com.berbils.game.Entities.FireEngines.FireEngine
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FireEngineFront
    public class FireEngine
extends BoxGameEntity
    A class used to generate Box Entitys and a sprite with in built resources used as limitations such as ammo for firing projectiles or health

    Contains all methods required to be used by a player

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      int currentHealth
      The current health of the fire engine, once this reaches zero the fire engine "dies" and the onDeath() method is called
      int currentWater
      The current water left in the fire engine, once this reaches zero it can no longer fire
      boolean leftFireStation
      A boolean value used in conjuction with the @FireStation class to determine whether the player should interact with the Fire Station
      float speed
      A constant speed multiplier used by the InputManager to change the amount of force applied and therefore the speed

      • Fields inherited from class com.berbils.game.Entities.EntityTypes.Entity

        catBits, entityBody, entityBodyDefinition, entityFixture, entityFixtureDefinition, entityShape, entitySprite, isStatic, maskBits, position, screen, sizeDims, spriteHandler, spriteLayer, userData, world

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      FireEngine​(PlayScreen screen, com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 dimensions, Weapon weapon, int maxWater, float speed, int maxHealth, java.lang.String textureFilePath)
      This constructor assigns required variables and sets up the weapon class instance for use.It only creates a fixture and body definition, no sprite, body or fixture generation.

    • Field Detail

      • currentWater

        public int currentWater
        The current water left in the fire engine, once this reaches zero it can no longer fire

      • currentHealth

        public int currentHealth
        The current health of the fire engine, once this reaches zero the fire engine "dies" and the onDeath() method is called

      • speed

        public float speed
        A constant speed multiplier used by the InputManager to change the amount of force applied and therefore the speed

      • leftFireStation

        public boolean leftFireStation
        A boolean value used in conjuction with the @FireStation class to determine whether the player should interact with the Fire Station

    • Constructor Detail

      • FireEngine

        public FireEngine​(PlayScreen screen,
                  com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 dimensions,
                  Weapon weapon,
                  int maxWater,
                  float speed,
                  int maxHealth,
                  java.lang.String textureFilePath)
        This constructor assigns required variables and sets up the weapon class instance for use.It only creates a fixture and body definition, no sprite, body or fixture generation.
        Parameters:
        screen - The Screen the entity object is located and will be created
        dimensions - The size dimensions of the entity in meters
        weapon - The weapon instance that the fire engine will use to fire projectiles
        maxWater - The max "ammo" resource for the weapon , it is consumed each time the fire engine instance fires and is the value the water resource is reset to
        speed - The speed of the fire engine, how fast it will move
        maxHealth - The max health for the fire engine instance and represents the maximum amount of damage the fire engine can take before death
        textureFilePath - The file path to the sprite texture Note - If passd as null no sprite will be created

    • Method Detail

      • fire

        public void fire​(com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 targetPos)
        Calls the fire method of the Weapon attached to the fire engine, spawning projectiles in the direction of the co-ords passed.Also updates water resource to mimic consumption.
        Parameters:
        targetPos - The vector co-ordinates of the target in meters

      • takeDamage

        public void takeDamage​(int damageTaken)
        Method for reducing the current health of the fire engine instance and checking whether the health reaches zero
        Parameters:
        damageTaken - the amount the fire engine health should be reduced by

      • onDeath

        public void onDeath()
        UPDATED Method @author Archie Godfrey Method is now public so it can be overriden in FireEngineFront Method called to represent fire engine death, updates scores, the current screen shown and what state the game will be in after the screens shown.

      • spawn

        public void spawn​(com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 spawnPos)
        This method sets the body position, then creates the body, fixture and creates an attached sprite
        Parameters:
        spawnPos - The position in meters where the fire engine should be created with the center of the fire engine being at this position.

      • moveTowards

        public void moveTowards​(com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 targetVector)
        NEW Method @author Archie Godfrey Method for moving the patrol towards a specified point
        Parameters:
        targetVector - the position ot move the patrol to

      • update

        public void update()
        NEW Method @author Archie Godfrey Called every frame, move the Fire Engine along it's path

      • createPath

        public void createPath​(com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 start,
                       com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 goal)
        NEW Method @author Archie Godfrey Set the path the fire engine will follow
        Parameters:
        start - The start of the path to follow
        goal - The end of the path to follow

      • reset

        public void reset​(boolean resetStats)
        UPDATED Method @author Archie Godfrey Resets the current health and current water atributes to their max values
        Parameters:
        resetStats - A boolean for whether the health and water of the fire engine should be reset to full

      • setAlive

        public void setAlive​(boolean alive)
        NEW Method @author Archie Godfrey Set whether the fire engine is alive or not
        Parameters:
        alive - True if alive, false if dead

      • getAlive

        public boolean getAlive()
        NEW Method @author Archie Godfrey Get whether the fire engine is alive or not
        Returns:
        whether the fire engine is alive or not
